name: Brooklands Guest House

reviews.title: First Class
reviews.text: Highly recommended. As good as most hotels and better than many, this Guest house provides excellent accommodation in a convenient location. Characterful decor and modern furnishings combine within a period property to provide a comfortable and interesting environment. Linen and towels (including bathrobes) are of high quality and other touches such as toiletries and provisions (including fruit, sweets, chocolates and biscuits) are generous and tasteful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent with a wide range of choices and good use of local provisions.
reviews.title: Awesome stay

reviews.text: On street parking (with permits provided by Brooklands) was safe and convenient.
reviews.title: Yep, it's good!

reviews.text: The owners were friendly and helpful and clearly very much committed to providing a good visitor experience.
reviews.title: A little bit of heaven on the c2c cycle route

reviews.text: This is our second visit to Brooklands- we were looking forward to an away "treat" and were not disappointed. We booked the Deluxe Suite and were very satisfied. Debbie, Leon and their staff pay so much attention to detail I would liken the accommodation standard more to a luxury hotel than a Bed & Breakfast. The room was beautifully appointed and comfortable. The breakfast was excellent- there is so much choice I defy anyone not to find something scrummy to eat. Definitely worth the money- definitely coming back!!
reviews.title: Faultless

reviews.text: This is quite possibily the most comfortable, cosy and generally lovely B and B i have ever stayed in. Myself and my friend stayed there for one night to attend a friend's wedding, and we had the twin room on the very top floor. The room was stunning - the decor is so luxorious, and the beds were so comfy - I had the best night's sleep I've had in years. The proprietor was so friendly, and the choice of foods at breakfast was out of this world - I had full english (delicious!) and my friend had homemade porridge, and toast with a variety of amazing jams. The fruit selection was lovely too.
reviews.title: AMAZING! Best B and B i've ever stayed in.

reviews.text: Even though its on a side street, I parked right outside, and there were plenty of spaces up and down the street so that shouldnt be a problem. Plus, you're literally 5 minutes walk from the town centre, which is ideal.
reviews.title: Best B&B I've stayed in by far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you stay here, you will not be disappointed. I will DEFINITELY be taking my boyfriend to stay in the future, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: A Five Star treasure!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quite simply, this is B and B heaven.
reviews.title: Consistently good service

reviews.text: x
reviews.title: What a find! This places put some more expensive hotels to shame.

reviews.text: Wonderful B&B in every way. I have absolutely no complaints and would recommend to others. Thank you for a lovely stay!
reviews.title: Simply excellent!

reviews.text: After a lifetime working in the travel industry i have at last found the perfect guest house, 10 out of 10 for everything,treat yourself and it will not break the bank.
reviews.title: What a nice surprise

reviews.text: Brooklands Guest house was a very welcome retreat after a long days ride from Whitehaven. We were warmly welcomed by the lovely Leon into this comfortable and elegant house and were delighted to find that our room had a dressed four poster bed. Everything that you could have wanted to have been included (but normally isn't) was close to hand, ranging from fresh fruit and a bathroom cabinet full of goodies normally associated with the larger expensive hotels, to yummy biscuits and a flat screen tv and wifi. Breakfast was 1st class and the place was spotless. A lot of thought has obviously gone into the planning and design. Hands down, this is the BEST guest house we have ever stayed in and if you are thinking about booking it, just do it.
reviews.title: A guest house of guest houses.

reviews.text: We have used the Brooklands previously, when cycling the C2C and have always had great service. This was no exception. The rooms furnishings and extras are above what you would normally expect.
reviews.title: Best Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is all rounded off by a warm and friendly welcome. We look forward to booking gain net year.
reviews.title: highly recommendable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for one night in Brooklands B&B to break the journey south from Stranraer to Buckinghamshire, and we both wish we could have stayed longer, as both Brooklands and Penrith were fantastic. We arrived late one evening at about 9:45 and were greeted by Leon who showed us our beautiful, clean and comfortable bedroom. The bathroom was spotless as well.
reviews.title: Wish we could have stayed longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The following morning we were served a lovely cooked breakfast which complemented the 'serve yourself' options perfectly. The dining room is beautiful and clearly the whole B&B has been a work of heartfelt pride by its owners.
reviews.title: A comfortable 'Home from home'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of Brooklands was superb as it was only two or three minutes into the heart of Penrith where there are plenty of bars, restaurants and shops to keep you entertained.
reviews.title: Fantastic. Best guest house we have ever stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This lovely guest house is located just 5 minutes walk from the town centre and sits in a row of similar establishments (see my review of the Albany). They are all large, beautiful period buildings and this one has been tastefully renovated by the owners. Our en-suite room was delightful, the breakfast a great advert for Cumbria and the atmosphere unrushed! I don't think I need to waffle on anymore? .. one minor draw-back would be car parking, its on street. This is no problem from a security point of view, just remember that parking restrictions apply from 8am till 6pm (Mon to Sat - I think) and you will need a 2hour disc if you arrive before or leave after (which you will, cos the breakfast shoudn't be rushed!).
reviews.title: fully deserves the good recognition

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night as we were going to a gig in Penrith. Staying at this guest house changed a night out into a luxury break.
reviews.title: Great stay and have already recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Brookland B&B very well placed to visit the Lakes and offers the most wonderful breakfast to start your day. The bedrooms are really lovely with attention to details like toothbrushes, fruit and a spendid varety of teas like Assan etc. Your hosts are a really nice couple who care about you the traveller, I meet some of the regulars guest who were also full of praise. GO find out for yourself
reviews.title: Top B&B in Britain

reviews.text: Stayed for one night when looking for somewhere close to M6.Undoubtably one of the best B&B's I've stayed in. Very pleasing decor, supremely comfortable, friendly hosts and enticing breakfast menu. Lots of examples of serious attention to detail which is how it gets a Michelin placing I would imagine.
reviews.title: Extremely good

reviews.text: We usually stay here when visiting family, but haven't been for over a year. This trip was as good as usual, lovely people, fabulous Cumbrian sized breakfasts and a very, very comfortable room! I love staying here as there are always sweets, chocolates, biscuits and water in the room.....as well as a very comfortable bed. There is always fresh fruit for breakfast as well as a choice of cooked breakfasts to keep you going all day. My best recommdation is that we keep going back year after year. Leon and Debbie are brilliant hosts. Love it!
reviews.title: Another comfortable stay!

reviews.text: Stopped in Penrith for one night. Very well appointed family room (3 people), beautifully decorated Guest-house, just off main street. Excellent breakfast. Recommend without hesitation
reviews.title: Great rooms and location, pleasant helpful hosts

reviews.text: My family stayed in four rooms and had a wonderful stay - pity it was for only one night. All the rooms were fantastic, well decorated and spotlessly clean with some really nice touches. The beds were really comfortable. The owners are lovely and really made us feel welcome. Breakfast was amazing with an excellent choice and they were even able to accommodate our food allergies and dislikes. The guest house is easily accessible for the town and on street parking was no problem with the parking permit provided. I cannot recommend this place more highly.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Penrith

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can only agree with all of the other comments about Brooklands and the owners, Leon and Debbie. We have just had a lovely 2 night break and from the moment we arrived we were made very welcome, nothing was too much trouble. Our room was perfect with a four poster bed and had everything you could think of, including fresh fruit, a fridge with bottled water, sweets, and every kind of tea and coffee you could want. Breakfast was a delight with an excellent choice cooked fresh to order. I can highly recommend Brooklands Guesthouse, we will certainly be back!!
reviews.title: What a wonderful place!

reviews.text: Leon and Debbie have done absolutely everything to make Brooklands a total success. The rooms are just perfect. My room was a four poster bed, with a delightful en-suite bathroom. In every corner, a delightful touch, from a plate of fruit to sumptous curtains and cushions on the bed. And the breakfast, well! The fruit line up was better than Tescos, and top quality cereal too (Dorset cereals). Basically you could have whatever you want and if they didn't have it, they would have gone and made it, shopped for it or dug it up! So helpful. I was cycling the coast to coast and to know that I was going back to that wonderful bath after 54 miles almost made the torture of riding in pouring rain worth it! A total find.
reviews.title: You will not be disappointed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just under 2 hours from either Glasgow or Edinburgh, you will find yourself in a beautiful guesthouse that is conveniently located to explore The Lakes District in the UK. We were able to conveniently drive to Ambleside, Windermere, Hawkeshead, Ullswater and our absolute favorite, Gressmere. There are opportunities galore for hikes, walks, boating, relaxing and biking in the Lakes District and Penrith's Brooklands is a perfect, warm and gracious place to come home to.
reviews.title: Beautifully renovated guesthouse in Penrith, the gateway to the Northern Lakes

reviews.text: Comfortable beds, spacious rooms, all beautifully decorated by our hosts, Leon and Debbie. You can tell the guesthouse was a labor of love by all the attention to detail and good taste. The breakfast menu is delicious, served in a beautiful parlor.
reviews.title: Great Guest House-Fantastic Owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and two friends stayed here at the end of May for one night on our Lands End to John O'Groats cycle ride.
reviews.title: Surpassed expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: High quality rooms, service, and breakfast. This guest house really does deserve its 5* rating. I can safely say that if you stay here you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Very High Standard

reviews.text: Thank you for a warm welcome, a smile, a beautiful house, decorated to the highest standard, top quality everything, stunning breakfast and extra mile service! Loved it, I will be back :-)
reviews.title: Truly outstanding, cut above tge rest, setting new standards in B&Bs
Fantastic!
reviews.text: I have just returned from a two night stay at Brooklands with my husband and two young children and it was fantastic. We were made to feel very welcome and Debbie and Leon were really hospitable.

The breakfast was wonderful too and there was a great selection of food to choose from (even for our slightly fussy 3 year old!). The room was warm and comfortable and there were lots of lovely finishing touches.
reviews.title: what a fabulous guest house, we were so impressed on every aspect!

reviews.text: I would thoroughly recommend Brooklands as a guest house and would certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: So many nice touches make it extra special

reviews.text: Just a year since we were last at Brooklands and we were again more than satisfied with our stay. It takes something to set a standard, something else to achieve it and something more to maintain it. Debbie and Leon have done just that!
reviews.title: Happy Return
Pure Luxury!!
reviews.text: Beautifully furnished and extremely comfortable Guest House, superb shower with a fabulous ensuite and a lovely selection of toiletries. Breakfast was very enjoyable. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend.

Gorgeous guesthouse. Rooms all beautifully designed and finished. Wonderful extras, like the mini fridge with fresh mineral water, fruit platters, biscuits, chocolates and a HUGE choice of beverages all complimentary! And a lovely selection of toiletries. Beautiful fluffy robes and towels. Fantastic breakfasts with a huge selection. The whole place is immaculate too.
reviews.title: Gorgeous rooms a lovely stay - always

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed many times and in 3 different rooms, all fantastic.
reviews.title: Just fabulous

reviews.text: Absolute favourite of my boyfriend and I.
reviews.title: A cut above the rest!

description: Charming and elegant, Brooklands Guest House is situated in the heart of historic Penrith. Recently refurbished, our beautifully furnished rooms have fans, radio alarms, bottled water and hospitality tray with chocolates and biscuits, a selection of teas, coffee and hot chocolate. All our bathrooms come complete with dressing gowns, fluffy white towels and luxury toiletries for all our needs. Our aim is to provide the very best in comfort and service to our guests.
